Docutils' implementation of reStructuredText comes with various interpreted
text roles as standard. These are:

* Abbreviations: for instance, :abbreviation:`RST` is the abbreviation for
  reStructuredText.

* Acronyms: :acronym:`RIV` could be the acronym for "reStructuredText is
  versatile".

* Code may be specified ``import docutils``, although without any custom
  modification it results in the same as ``literal``.

* Emphasis: *emphasis*.
* Literal: ``literal``.
* Math: e.g. the area of a circle is :math:`A_\text{c} = (\pi/4) d^2`.
* PEP-reference: e.g. :pep-reference:`0008`
* RFC-reference: e.g. :rfc-reference:`5545`.
* Strong: **some strong text**.
* Subscript: :subscript:`Down Low`.
* Superscript: :superscript:`up high`.
* Title-reference: :title-reference:`This text is the name of a published
  work`.
